This teeny-tiny article needs some work. You can help us by
[expanding it.]
Ryuji Ochi (越智 龍二) is a programmer at
[Sega of Japan](/Sega_of_Japan). The first game he worked on was [Thunder Blade](/Thunder_Blade) [[1]](#cite_note-https:.2F.2Fweb.archive.org.2Fweb.2F20030804211946.2Fhttp:.2F.2Fwww.hitmaker.co.jp.2Ftop.2Flounge.2Fcorumun.2Fsite.2Fcorumun_txt69.htm-1). His earliest known work as lead programmer is [Title Fight](/Title_Fight). He later worked for [Sammy](/Sammy) and eventually [Sega Sammy Holdings](/Sega_Sammy_Holdings). As of August 2021 he has returned to Sega.
Production history
[Thunder Blade](/Thunder_Blade)( [X Board](/X_Board); 1987) — Programmer [Last Survivor](/Last_Survivor)( [X Board](/X_Board); 1989) — Programmer [Michael Jackson's Moonwalker](/Michael_Jackson%27s_Moonwalker_(System_18))( [System 18](/System_18); 1990) [Title Fight](/Title_Fight)( [System 32](/System_32); 1993) — Programmers (as R.Ochi) [Baku Baku Animal](/Baku_Baku_Animal)( [Sega Titan Video](/Sega_Titan_Video); 1995) — Special Thanks (as Ryouji Ochi) [Baku Baku Animal](/Baku_Baku_Animal)( [Saturn](/Saturn); 1995) — Special Thanks [[3]](#cite_note-:File:Baku_Baku_Animal_Saturn_credits.pdf_p-3) [Funky Head Boxers](/Funky_Head_Boxers)( [Sega Titan Video](/Sega_Titan_Video); 1996) — Programmer [Decathlete](/Decathlete)( [Saturn](/Saturn); 1996) — Programmers [Dirt Devils](/Dirt_Devils)( [Model 3](/Model_3); 1998) — Software
